com.readytalk.swt.widgets.notifications

Class Bubble

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget
      • com.readytalk.swt.widgets.notifications.PopOverShell
        • com.readytalk.swt.widgets.notifications.Bubble
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FadeEffect.Fadeable

    public class Bubble
extends PopOverShell
    Instances of this class represent contextual information about a UI element.

    Bubble will attempt to always be visible on screen.
    If the default Bubble would appear off-screen, we will calculate a suitable location to appear.

    Bubble utilizes the system font, and allows TextTokenizerType.WIKI style syntax to customize the appearance of the text in your Bubble.
    Bubble will also break up lines that would be longer than 400 pixels when drawn.
    You can short-circuit this logic by providing your own line-breaks with \n characters in the text.
    We will never format your text if your provide your own formatting.

    • Method Detail

      • createBubbleForCustomWidget

        public static Bubble createBubbleForCustomWidget(CustomElementDataProvider customElementDataProvider,
                                 java.lang.String text,
                                 BubbleTag... tags)
                                          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Creates and attaches a bubble to a component that implements CustomElementDataProvider. This is a convenience constructor which assumes you do not want the Bubble text to appear in a Bold font.
        Parameters:
        customElementDataProvider - The CustomElementDataProvider element that the Bubble provides contextual help about
        text - The text you want to appear in the Bubble
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the parentControl or text is null

      • createBubble

        public static Bubble createBubble(org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Control parentControl,
                  java.lang.String text,
                  BubbleTag... tags)
        Creates and attaches a Bubble to any SWT Control (or descendant). This is a convenience constructor which assumes you do not want the Bubble text to appear in a Bold font.
        Parameters:
        parentControl - The parent element that the Bubble provides contextual help about
        text - The text you want to appear in the Bubble
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the parentControl or text is null

      • setVerticalLocation

        public Bubble setVerticalLocation(VerticalLocation verticalLocation)
        Sets the VerticalLocation. VerticalLocation represents the relative visual location between this bubble and its parent. The default is set to VerticalLocation.BELOW.
        Parameters:
        verticalLocation -

      • setCenteringEdge

        public Bubble setCenteringEdge(CenteringEdge centeringEdge)
        Sets the CenteringEdge. CenteringEdge represents the relative visual location between this bubble and its parent. By default, Bubble is set to center its left edge on the parent.
        Parameters:
        centeringEdge -

      • show

        public void show()
        Description copied from class: PopOverShell
        Shows the PopOverShell in a suitable location relative to the parent component. Classes extending PopOverShell will provide the Region via the abstract getAppropriatePopOverRegion() method.
        Overrides:
        show in class PopOverShell

      • addTags

        public void addTags(BubbleTag... bubbleTags)
        Add tags to a previously created Bubble.

        Tags can be shown by calling BubbleRegistry.getInstance.showBubblesByTag(BubbleTag tag)
        Parameters:
        bubbleTags - Tags to associate with this Bubble
